title: A1466 820-00165-A trackpad
message:
Hi,

I have an A1466 820-00165-A that has problems with trackpad. Already replaced 3 TP, but they all die after a while.

The trackpad board gets very, very hot, and after a few days the trackpad and keyboard stop working.

I have no ideia from where to start.

Can you help?

title: A1466 820-00165-A trackpad
message: Check voltage on J4800 power rails.

title: A1466 820-00165-A trackpad
message:
I don't see any reason for TP board to get hot by itselff, if all its power rails are in range.
Are you sure the heat is not caused by the battery?

Just in case, bypass L4820 and R4830.

title: A1466 820-00165-A trackpad
message:
Yes, I'm sure. I've already taken out the battery, and the big IC just under the TP cable conector, on the trackpad board, gets very hot (can't even leave the finger on top of it).

Sorry for my ignorance, but how can i bypass those exactly? Can i just remove them?

title: A1466 820-00165-A trackpad
message:
Bypass supposes to make short between their pins.
Try with L4820 first...
